title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.31 | 29-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dasya Gyananjani Shalakaya Chakshurunmeenitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual master and Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: By pure meditation looking at Lord Sri Krishna, He at once was freed from all material inauspiciousness and was relieved of all bodily pains caused by the arrow wounds.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami introduces the 31st verse of the 9th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining how Bhishma, through pure meditation on Lord Krishna, was freed from material inauspiciousness and bodily pain.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma is simultaneously a expert ashtanga yogi and also perfect bhakti yogi he is simultaneously both he is teaching by his example how a astanga yogi should prepare himself for quitting the body he is also teaching the devotees how a devotee should prepare himself to quit his body both he is teaching
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Bhishma's example as both an expert Ashtanga Yogi and a perfect Bhakti Yogi, emphasizing his role as a Mahajana and an authority on Dharma, aiming for the highest perfection of returning to God.

segments.key_quote: This material body is full of inauspiciousness in so many ways what is this body made up of flesh and blood and bone and stool and mucus and urine and all kinds of obnoxious things so this body which we adore so much just because of some facility for sense enjoyment we give a lot of value to the body and we are forgetting that this body after all is something material and not made up of very nice substances
segments.summary: The lecture delves into the nature of the material body, describing it as full of inauspiciousness and made of undesirable substances, highlighting the ignorance in adoring it and forgetting its true nature.

segments.key_quote: So bhishma deva by fixing his attention on krishna the transcendental form of krishna in front of him completely being absorbed in meditation on krishna he was freed at once from all material inauspiciousness his conscience became completely spiritualized krishna consciousness he became situated and complete krishna consciousness
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Bhishma, by focusing on Krishna's transcendental form, was freed from material inauspiciousness and became situated in Krishna consciousness, emphasizing that identification with the material body is due to forgetfulness of our eternal relationship with the Lord.

segments.key_quote: For a pure devotee of the Lord like Bhishma Deva this illusion was at once removed as soon as the Lord arrived as soon as Krishna came in front of Bhishma Deva by just fixing his attention on Krishna who is the most attractive personality most attractive beautiful form in the whole creation that supremely attractive Krishna came in front of Bhishma Deva Bhishma Deva at once fixed his attention on Krishna and all his illusion was gone
segments.summary: The lecture continues by explaining that the identification with the body and mind is an illusion, which is removed by devotion to Krishna, comparing Krishna to the sun and material energy to darkness, which disappears upon Krishna's arrival.

segments.key_quote: When we are not krishna conscious then our consciousness is limited to our body and the mind in such a state of consciousness we are acting we are performing activities uh with our senses with the body uh in collaboration with matter that means the original senses which are our spiritual senses they are the ones we are utilizing for performing material activities
segments.summary: The speaker explains that when we are not Krishna conscious, our consciousness is limited to the body and mind, leading to impure material activities through the senses, emphasizing the difference between material and spiritual senses.

segments.key_quote: When we revive our contact with the supreme lord krishna through devotional service or through yoga practice the senses again become freed from material contamination then our original senses spiritual senses are awakened and we act with our spiritual senses we act spiritually through with spiritual senses we act perform spiritual activities the same activities
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by explaining how devotional service and yoga can revive our contact with Krishna, awakening our spiritual senses and enabling us to perform spiritual activities, emphasizing the ease of contacting Krishna through chanting the Hare Krishna mantra.
